page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT IN RINGSTEAD
page.content: The working population is mainly employed by the three farms.There have been reductions in the numbers of men needed in recent years as modern methods have been introduced.No new men have been engaged and natural wastage has reduced the work force.The situation has now stabilised and it is envisaged that the presant level of employment on farms will be maintained Small numbers are engaged at nursary in horticulture at a nursary. Local tradesmen such as the blacksmith have disappeared from rural life,but overall there is no worsening of the unemployment situation as many houses and cottages in the area are now owned by weekenders and holiday migrants and retired people.Incursion of holiday homes can be detrimental but here it appears to make a valuable contribution to village and life.
